data: 50 mL, IV, as directed, PRN other (see comment), duration: one dose or time, drug form: bag
Pathologist approval of first order required. Complete Canadian Blood Services Requisition and fax to Transfusion Medicine (TM)

Solvent Detergent treated (SD) plasma is not kept in regular inventory. After requesting, it may take several hours to obtain product from Canadian Blood Services. If the patient requires urgent treatment, standard plasma or cryosupernatant plasma may be used until SD plasma is available

Indications:   - Thrombotic Thrombocytopenic Purpura   - Hemolytic Uremic Syndrome   - Clotting factor deficiency   Supporting criteria:   - Patient has experienced an allergic reaction to plasma   - Patient has a pre-existing lung disorder   - Patient is group AB and needs plasma, but a group compatible product is unavailable
Routine, Administer: 3 unit, IV, Administer each over: 30 - 60 Minutes, T;N
Routine, Administer: 4 unit, IV, Administer each over: 30 - 60 Minutes, T;N
